result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Nissan A Hudson in court with attorney Jamie McClendon.  Defendant Nissan A Hudson in custody.  Robert Scott Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Plea questionnaire filed.  
State's offer and recommendation:  Plea to charge in 14CF1027; d/ri 14cf1175.  Recommend prison, standing silent on amt and bifurcation.
Court colloquy with defendant re rights being waived and elements of crime.  
Plea - no contest
State consents to jury waiver.
Finding of guilt.  Court finds plea entered freely, knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently.
PSI ordered
  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for 01-12-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defense is asking for a reduction of bail to $2,500.00 or co-signature bond signed by deft's mother. Defense is asking for GPS monitoring as a condition. The State objects citing the nature of the offenses.

BTC: Bond modification is denied
Bail/bond hearing on September 5, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Preliminary hearing on August 28, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  No contact with the victim (person, property, residence or family).  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
